control_descriptions.CC6.1: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.2: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enforced for all user accounts, including root accounts, IAM users, and federated users. This includes console access and programmatic access where applicable.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.3: Password policies enforce minimum complexity (length, special characters, numbers), prevent password reuse, and require periodic changes. Account lockout is implemented after defined failed attempts.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.4: Network access control lists (NACLs) and security groups are configured with least-privilege access, default deny rules, and specific allow rules for required traffic only.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.6: All public endpoints use TLS 1.2 or higher with strong cipher suites. Certificate validity and expiration are monitored.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.7: All data at rest is encrypted using AWS KMS or customer-managed keys with AES-256. This includes EBS volumes, RDS instances, S3 buckets, and other storage services.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.8: AWS KMS is used for key management with automatic key rotation, access logging, and strict IAM policies. Customer-managed keys follow documented key management procedures.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.9: IAM roles and groups implement least-privilege access with regular reviews. Service roles use specific permission boundaries and SCPs where applicable.
control_descriptions.CC6.1.10: Customer data encryption uses envelope encryption with unique data keys. Key policies enforce automatic rotation and access logging.
control_descriptions.CC6.6.1: AWS Config rules monitor and enforce infrastructure compliance. CloudFormation templates and Terraform configurations manage infrastructure as code.
control_descriptions.CC6.6.2: GuardDuty, SecurityHub, and CloudWatch monitor for security events. Alerts are integrated with incident response workflows.
control_descriptions.CC6.6.3: AWS WAF and Shield protect against DDoS and application-layer attacks. Network firewall rules block malicious traffic patterns.
control_descriptions.CC6.6.4: CloudWatch Logs, CloudTrail, and Security Hub integrate with SIEM solutions. Log retention policies meet compliance requirements.
control_descriptions.CC7.1: Regular vulnerability assessments include AWS Inspector scans, penetration testing, and compliance audits.
control_descriptions.CC7.1.2: AWS Inspector performs network reachability analysis and vulnerability scans. Results are tracked in SecurityHub.
control_descriptions.CC7.1.3: Web application security testing includes automated DAST scans integrated with CI/CD pipelines.
control_descriptions.CC7.1.5: ECR image scanning and EKS security policies enforce container security standards. Failed checks block deployments.
control_descriptions.CC8.1: Change management processes include security reviews, testing requirements, and rollback procedures.
control_descriptions.CC8.1.5: CI/CD pipelines include automated security testing, SAST, and compliance checks. Failed security tests block deployments.
control_descriptions.CC8.1.9: CodePipeline and CodeDeploy provide deployment notifications and metrics. Failed deployments trigger automated rollbacks.
control_descriptions.CC9.1: Risk assessments incorporate AWS security assessments, compliance reports, and threat intelligence.
control_descriptions.C1.1: Data classification policies define handling requirements for different data types. AWS services are configured to enforce these requirements.
